description.p: A pearly white longsword with a hilt pointed on both ends. It is too powerful to wield with only one hand. This item is legendary.

ul.li: When in the sun, you obtain an extra 2d6 or +3 damage, whichever is higher.
When attacking an enemy with an AC higher than yours, gain advantage on all hits against them.

description.p: This weapon is a mere ordinary spear with a silvery tint.
A glorious shortsword with magical runes running across it's silver hilt.

p.b: This item requires 14 wisdom to wield.

ul.li: As a bonus action, the wielder creates mystical fireballs to absorb damage that would normally damage them.
A dice roll of 1d3 will determine how many mystical fireballs are summoned.
Each fireball will absorb 4 damage before disappearing.
This ability can be used as an action, increasing the dice roll to summon fireballs to 1d6, and the fireballs will absorb 8 damage each.
Can be used twice per short rest.

description.p: Visual description not yet added by beefer. For now, just imagine it how you wish!

ul.li: Bestie Bond: When standing directly next to someone with the same amount of HP as you, this sword's damage becomes 4d6+4.

description.p: This weapon is an unbreakable katana with a +4 attack bonus. It deals 1d8+4 slashing damage.
It can only be used in 3 clashes, and upon the third clash, it will break.
When an attacking spell is cast against you, you may attempt to attack it to deflect or destroy it, must hit DC. This ability can be used thrice per long rest.
This longsword is made from the spine of a ruthless dragon, slain by the Corrupt Sorcerer of Runia.
Upon attuning you may pick a dragon type, based on that type of dragon you pick you are allowed to make an action ‘Breath attack’ that will deal [3d6] 3 times per short rest.

p.b: ADD BREATH TYPE TO THE NOTES OF THIS ITEM.

description.p: In some cultures this strong, single-edged sword is a symbol of honor and prestige. The katana is intended for two-handed use, but it's light enough to be wielded one-handed.

Finesse Variant. Historically, katanas widely varied in size and weight. If you would prefer a katana that emphasizes fast, precise cuts, replace the versatile property with the finesse property and reduce the weight to 2 lbs.
A shotgun whose barrel seems to always be casted in shadow.
On attack, the user and the victim must make dexterity saving throws. Success for the user will allow them to hold their footing and not move. Success for the targeted will halve damage.
A handheld pistol that draws energy from antimatter around us.
When rolling damage, if the dice roll is max, gain +5 temporary hit points.
Though it is not an inherent property of this weapon, it can be wielded with two hands to increase the range to 30/60.

The Zuishin Tekkan is a staff that has multiple ‘forms.’ Each form does a different amount of damage and it requires a bonus action to switch forms, but you attack at disadvantage on that turn. The staff is 5 feet tall, and is thick enough to hold one person's weight. Switching modes shrinks it to a preferable size. Its forms are staff mode, nunchaku mode, and three-section-staff mode.

sheet.description: When you’re in the air, you can kick into the air and send down a wind slash as sharp as a high end blade, this deals [1d8+{{dexterity:modifier}}] slashing damage.
When you’re in the air, use your action to send down a barrage of wind slashes that deal [3d8+{{dexterity:modifier}}] slashing damage.

description.p: A pair of silver and golden legs that look to be from a medieval armor set. They can be worn as greaves or replace ones legs. Attuning to this item grants 30 feet of flight, and as a bonus action when you’re in the air, you can kick into the air and send down a wind slash which is as sharp as a high end blade, this deals [1d8+dex] slashing damage. Or use your action to send down a barrage of these wind slashes that deal [3d8+dex] slashing damage. This ability can be used in a clash, and a successful roll is a crit.

When you land a successful strike, you may spend 1 Ki point to deal a second impact in the blink of an eye. Phantasmal fangs cover your hand as you flatten it and jab your opponent, and the fangs bite down at the point of impact, but your haste prevents it from doing the fullest damage though: [1d8+4] piercing damage.

sheet.description: When you land a successful strike, spend 1 Ki point to deal a second impact that deals 1d8+4 piercing damage.

description.p: Use an action to protect yourself and an ally within 5ft of you. Grant yourself +5 Ac, and your ally +2. If the attack is still successful, obtain the benefits of "Rage." (thrice per long rest)

sheet.description: Use an action to protect yourself and an ally within 5ft of you. Grant yourself +5 Ac, and your ally +2. If the attack is still successful, obtain the benefits of "Rage."

description.p: You channel your ki into the wolf marks on your arms, and phantasmal wolves come out of them. It is controlled by the DM, but will assist in the best way that it can. A max of 2 wolves can be activate at once. They disappear in 3 turns, and they assist in clashes.

sheet.description: Summon two phantasmal wolves that laugh and snarl respectively. 2 can be activate at once, and they disappear in 3 turns.

description.p: Two marks resembling wolves appear on your arms; One is snarling with rage, and the other is howling with laughter.

p.b: This item grants +3 vs AC bonus to unarmed strikes.
